title.narrative: Documentation of Ancient Ceremonial Sites of the Pre-Columbian Ulwa Culture in the Municipality of Muelle de los Bueyes

description.narrative: Ancient Pre-Columbian objects uncovered at nine archaeological sites in Muelle de los Bueyes lack proper documentation or assessment. This project, which includes the compilation of site and collections inventories, directly supports the U.S. embassys efforts to engage with the Autonomous Region of South Caribbean Coast. It also supports the treaty between the United States and Nicaragua concerning the looting and illicit trafficking of Nicaraguan cultural property.

title.narrative: Preservation of Pre-Columbian Cailagua Petroglyphs and the Indian Path of Bombonasi

description.narrative: The Cailagua petroglyphs and the path of Bombonasi are regional landmarks and cultural treasures of the Monimb people, one of Nicaraguas most active indigenous communities. This project involves the inventory and conservation of petroglyphs and community engagement in sustainable tourism best practices.

title.narrative: Documentation of Awaltara Archaeological Sites of the Indigenous Ulwa Territories

description.narrative: The Ulwa people have inhabited the Nicaraguan Caribbean for centuries, but their cultural sites are undocumented. This project includes an inventory of Ulwa sites for preservation planning purposes.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs
Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

title.narrative: Remedial Preservation of the 17th-Century San Francisco Church in Leon

description.narrative: To support the remedial preservation of the San Francisco Church in Leon, one of the five chapels of the 17th-century cathedral and the site of an important collection of sacred art and colonial furniture. The church roof is in critical condition, endangering the entire structure and contents. The project involves remedial repairs to the roof and the restoration of the churchs unique baroque ceiling.

title.narrative: Restoration of the Church of Maria Magdalena in Totogalpa (Phase 3)

description.narrative: One of the oldest colonial buildings and the second-oldest church in Nicaragua, the Church of Maria Magdalena is known for its distinctively Nicaraguan blend of architectural styles and serves its community variously as a church, community center, and emergency shelter. Phase 3 of this on-going project includes remedial restoration work on the tower and interior.

title.narrative: Providing Comprehensive Protection Services to Child Victims of TIP Crimes and Those At Risk of Being Trafficked in Nicaragua

description.narrative: Casa Alianza Nicaraguas (CANs) FY2012 proposal builds on the many accomplishments of their 2008-2010 and 2011-2012 J/TIP projects, and presents innovative strategies to expand Nicaraguas efforts to raise awareness, protect children who have been trafficked and are at risk of being trafficked, and institutionalize systems designed to more effectively prosecute traffickers. Under "Prevention" they will amplify the reach and content of their already extensive "NO a La Trata" campaign. Under "Protection " CAN will continue to provide street outreach and a multidisciplinary residential treatment program for 600 child victims and potential child victims of trafficking in a country where these kinds of services are simply not available They will also undertake a study geared to measure the impact of our protection and treatment services.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles
